segment.source: MED-V 2.0 Release Notes
segment.target: MED-V 2.0 Release Notes

segment.source: MED-V 2.0 Release Notes
segment.target: MED-V 2.0 Release Notes

segment.source: MED-V 2.0 Release Notes
segment.target: MED-V 2.0 Release Notes

segment.source: Updated: March 10, 2011
segment.target: Updated: March 10, 2011

segment.source: To search these release notes, press CTRL+F.
segment.target: To search these release notes, press CTRL+F.

segment.source: Read these release notes thoroughly before you install the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 platform.
segment.target: Read these release notes thoroughly before you install the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 platform.

segment.source: These release notes contain information that is required to successfully install MED-V 2.0 and contain information that is not available in the product documentation.
segment.target: These release notes contain information that is required to successfully install MED-V 2.0 and contain information that is not available in the product documentation.

segment.source: If there is a difference between these release notes and other MED-V platform documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.
segment.target: If there is a difference between these release notes and other MED-V platform documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.

segment.source: These release notes supersede the content included with this product.
segment.target: These release notes supersede the content included with this product.

segment.source: About the Product Documentation
segment.target: About the Product Documentation

segment.source: Documentation for Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 is distributed with the product and is also located at Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization 2.0 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=207065).
segment.target: Documentation for Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 is distributed with the product and is also located at Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization 2.0 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=207065).

segment.source: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses
segment.target: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses

segment.source: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, we recommend that you install the latest available security updates for any new software being installed.
segment.target: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, we recommend that you install the latest available security updates for any new software being installed.

segment.source: For more information, see Microsoft Security (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482).
segment.target: For more information, see Microsoft Security (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482).

segment.source: Known Issues with MED-V 2.0
segment.target: Known Issues with MED-V 2.0

segment.source: This section provides the most up-to-date information about issues with the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 platform.
segment.target: This section provides the most up-to-date information about issues with the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 platform.

segment.source: These issues do not appear in the product documentation and in some cases might contradict existing product documentation.
segment.target: These issues do not appear in the product documentation and in some cases might contradict existing product documentation.

segment.source: When it is possible, these issues will be addressed in later releases.
segment.target: When it is possible, these issues will be addressed in later releases.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: There are currently no known issues with MED-V 2.0.
segment.target: There are currently no known issues with MED-V 2.0.
